5079164.majtheme: Financial and private sector development,Environment and natural resource management

repnme.cdata!:
Korea - Gas System Expansion Project :
            environmental impact assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental impact assessment for
            the Korea Gas System Expansion Project describes anticipated
            negative environmental impacts and their mitigations.
            Terminal construction is expected to cause changes in the
            topography and the marine ecosystem, as well as cause
            impacts in air quality, seawater quality, and noise levels.
            Specifically, dredging works and site preparation will
            affect the marine environment and the natural topography.
            Tides, tidal discharge, current velocity, sedimentation, and
            marine species and quantity reduction of eggs, young fish,
            plankton, Benthos, and shellfish may result. Sewage
            discharged during construction and operation may affect
            seawater quality if disposed without treatment. Methods for
            reducing potentially harmful impacts include installing
            filters, scheduling work, installing dust barriers, and
            washing facilities for vehicles to mitigate air pollution.
            To prevent seawater pollution, install silt protectors to
            contain the production of suspended solids during land
            reclamation and dredging, operate sewage treatment systems,
            and provide an oil "fence" in the event of a
            spillage accident caused by a tank carrier. To decrease
            noise levels, construction vehicles will operate at low
            speed and nighttime work will be lomited during
            construction. After facilities are completed, a firefighting
            system will be installed in case of emergency.

            Natural Gas (LNG) receiving terminal; (b) construction of
            additional pipeline capacity to deliver the increased
            terminal throughput; and (c) utilization of
            consultants' services for the engineering of terminal
            extension and pipeline expansion. The terminal extension
            component comprises the installation of two 100,000

repnme.cdata!:
Korea - Gas System Expansion Project :
            environmental assessment report on the construction work of
            Pyongtaek LNG receiving terminal

abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment for the
            portion of the Korea Gas Expansion project pertaining to the
            construction work of Pyongtaek LNG Receiving Terminal
            outlines potential, negative environmental impacts and their
            proposed mitigations. Expected changes to topography include
            changes caused by disposing of dredged soil and by
            accumulating building materials for construction work. The
            amount of suspended solids because of the outflow of muddy
            water would only minimally affect the quality of seawater
            and its ecological balance, but building embankments and
            erosion control will offset this impact. Because fishery
            resources may be affected, compensation should be considered
            for affected populations. Although the risk of gas leakage
            is reduced because the weight if liquid natural gas (LNG) is
            lighter and less explosive than LPG, potential accidents can
            be avoided by using detectors and alarms, providing safety
            education, and improving skills in accident prevention.

docna.cdata!:
Korea - Gas System Expansion Project :
            environmental assessment report on the construction work of
            Pyongtaek LNG receiving terminal
